content: shown for left handed crocheting 3 alice s wool works pattern instructions part1-singlepannel foundation chain chain 35 or the amount needed to reach the length of your book - make sure it is an odd number 35 r1 ws chain 1 and turn working in the back bump of each chain see photos 2 3 and 4 half_double_crochet in the second chain from your hook then half_double_crochet in each remaining chain 35 photo 2 upper side of the foundation chain photo 3 flip the chain upside down and find with the regular v chs the back bumps photo 4 place the first half_double_crochet in the second back bump from the hook and place your next sts the same way 4 alice s wool works r2 rs chain 1 and turn half_double_crochet in the first st *chain 1 skip 1 half_double_crochet in the next st repeat * for the rest of the row 35 r3 chain 1 and turn half_double_crochet in the first st *half_double_crochet in the next chain space half_double_crochet in the next st repeat * for the rest of the row 35 r4 to 18 repeat r2 and r3 until you reach the width to cover the front of the book make sure you get to an even number of row r 19 + first increase chain 1 and turn half_double_crochet in the first st *half_double_crochet in the next chain space half_double_crochet in the next st repeat * to the end place the stitch marker in the last stitch continue with chain 19 or chain the same odd number of row you just completed for the front cover chain 1 to secure and fasten_off 54 second increase + r 20 with the rs facing you make a slip knot and join your yarn with a tight slip_stitch on the first st of the previous row on the opposite side of the first increase you just did this slip_stitch does not count as a st place a stitch marker in the first stitch chain 19 73 do not fasten_off photo 5 front cover with first increase and second increase r 21 chain 1 and turn half_double_crochet in the second chain from your hook half_double_crochet in every chain half_double_crochet in the same st where the slip_stitch is placed half_double_crochet in each st and chain to the end of the row 73 r 22 to 24 or even number of row needed to cover the binding chain 1 and turn half_double_crochet in every st 73 on the last row fasten_off you have now completed the binding and pages cover part of your sleeve 5 alice s wool works r 25 decrease row we will now decrease our work to go back to the size of the front cover in order to create the back cover with the ws facing you make a slip knot and join the yarn with a tight slip_stitch on the 20 th st see photo 6 half_double_crochet in the same st you just joined your yarn into half_double_crochet
